thing-type.label: DCH-Z110 Door & Window Sensor
thing-type.description: Door &amp; Window Sensor<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe sensor DCH-Z110 has a door/window sensor integrated with, temperature and illumination, which are 3 sensors function in one, based on Z-WaveTM technology</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gt.Pressing tamper key three times within 1.5 seconds to enter the inclusion mode.</p&gt <p&gtAfter add successful, the device will wake to receive the setting command from Z-WaveTM Controller about 20 seconds.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtPressing tamper key three times within 1.5 seconds to enter the exclusion mode</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtPress the tamper key once. The device will wake-up 10 seconds.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Basic Set Level
parameter.description: Setting the BASIC command value to turn on the light.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gt0: Turn off the light.</li&gt <li&gt1 - 100: For dimmers 1 to 100 means the light level.</li&gt <li&gt255: Turns on the light. (Default) </li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: PIR Sensitivity
parameter.description: Set the sensitivity for the PIR (Passive Infrared Sensor).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gt0 = Disable the PIR motion detection.</li&gt <li&gt1 - 99 = 1 means the lowest sensitivity, 99 means the highest sensitivity</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtHigh sensitivity means de</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Light Threshold
parameter.description: Set the illumination threshold to turn on the light.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhen the event triggers and the environment illumination is lower than the threshold, the device will turn on the light.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 = Turn off illumination detected function and never turn</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Operation Mode
parameter.description: Operation Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParameter to set the Operation Mode.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtBit 0: Reserved.</li&gt <li&gtBit 1: 1 means enable test mode; 0 means normal mode. Notice: Ignored if DIP Switch is not set to Customer Mode.</li&gt <li&gtBit 2: Disable the door/window function(1:Disable, 0:Enable)</li&gt <li&gtBit3: Setting the temperature scale. 0: Fahrenheit, 1:Celsius </li&gt <li&gtBit4: Disable the illumination report after event triggered. (1:Disable, 0:Enable) </li&gt <li&gtBit5: Disable the temperature report after event triggered. (1:Disable, 0:Enable) </li&gt <li&gtBit6: Reserved.</li&gt <li&gtBit7: Disable the back key release into test mode. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

options.option: Preset: Celsius and LED on = Bits: 00001010 = 10

parameter.name: config_6_1
parameter.label: 6: Multi-Sensor Function Switch
parameter.description: Multi-Sensor Function Switch<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParameter to set the sensor functions.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtBit 0: Disable magnetic integrate illumination to turn on the lighting nodes in the association group 2. 1: Disable, 0: Enable</li&gt <li&gtBit1: Disable PIR integrate Illumination to turn ON the lighting nodes in the association group 2. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</li&gt <li&gtBit2: Disable magnetic integrate PIR to turn ON the lighting nodes in the association group 2. (1:Disable, 0:Enable) (Default is Disable) </li&gt <li&gtBit3: When Bit2 is 0 (Enable), Are the device and the lighting in the same room? 0: In the same room(Default), 1: In the different room. Notice: If this bit is 1, it is recommended also set the Bit1 to 1, cause the PIR triggered, doesn't mean the people in that room. </li&gt <li&gtBit4: Disable delay 5 seconds to turn off the light, when door/window closed. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</li&gt <li&gtBit5: Disable auto turn off the light, after door/window opened to turn on the light. (1:Disable, 0:Enable) Notice: If bit2 is zero, this setting is useless. Notice: If the configuration No.9 is zero, this setting is useless</li&gt <li&gtBit6: Reserve.</li&gt <li&gtBit7: Reserve.</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 7: Customer Function
parameter.description: Parameter to set the Customer Function.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtl</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Enable PIR Super Sensitivity and Binary Report

parameter.name: config_7_1_00000008
parameter.label: 7: Disable send of BASIC OFF after door closed

parameter.name: config_7_1_00000020
parameter.label: 7: Disable Multi CC in auto report

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: PIR Re-Detect Interval Time
parameter.description: PIR Re-Detect Interval Time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIn the normal mode, after the PIR motion detected, setting the re-detect time. 8 seconds per tick, default is 3 (24 seconds).</p&gt <p&gtSetting the suitable value to prevent received the trigger signal too frequently. Also can save the battery energy.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNotice:</strong&gt If this value bigger than the configuration setting NO. 9. There is a period after the light turned off and the PIR not start detecting.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Turn Off Light Time
parameter.description: Turn Off Light Time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAfter turn on the lighting, setting the delay time to turn off the lighting when the PIR motion is not detected. 8 seconds per tick, default tick is 4 (32 seconds).</p&gt <p&gt0 means never send turn off light command.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: Auto Report Battery Time
parameter.description: Auto Report Battery Time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for auto report the battery level.</p&gt <p&gt0 means turn off auto report battery. The default value is 12.</p&gt <p&gtThe tick time can setting by the configuration No.20</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: Auto Report Door/Window State Time
parameter.description: Auto Report Door/Window State Time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for auto report the door/window state.</p&gt <p&gt0 means turn off auto report door/window state. The default value is 12.</p&gt <p&gtThe tick time can setting by the configuration No.20.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: Auto Report Illumination Time
parameter.description: Auto Report Illumination Time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for auto report the illumination.</p&gt <p&gt0 means turn off auto report illumination. The default value is 12.</p&gt <p&gtThe tick time can setting by the configuration No.20</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: Auto Report Temperature Time
parameter.description: Auto Report Temperature Time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for auto report the temperature.</p&gt <p&gt0 means turn off auto report temperature. The default value is 12.</p&gt <p&gtThe tick time can setting by the configuration No.20.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Auto Report Tick Interval
parameter.description: Auto Report Tick Interval<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for each auto report tick. Setting this configuration will effect configuration No.10, No.11, No.12 and No.13.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 = Turn off all auto report functions. </li&gt <li&gt1-255 = Interval time for each tick. Default is 30. Unit is in minutes</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Temperature Differential Report
parameter.description: Temperature Differential Report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe temperature differential to report. 0 means turn off this function. The unit is Fahrenheit. Enable this function the device will detect every minutes. And when the temperature is over 140 degree Fahrenheit, it will continue report.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtEnable this functionality will cause some issue please see the detail in the “Temperature Report” section.</strong&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_22_1
parameter.label: 22: Illumination Differential Report
parameter.description: Illumination Differential Report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe illumination differential to report. 0 means turn off this function. The unit is percentage. Enable this function the device will detect every minutes.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtEnable this functionality will cause some issue please see the detail in the “Illumination Report” section.</strong&gt</p&gt</p&gt
